output.conclusion: Upon completion of this course, students will possess a comprehensive understanding of advanced environmental engineering principles and be equipped to address complex environmental challenges with innovative and sustainable solutions.
output.introduction: This advanced course delves into the intricacies of environmental engineering, building upon foundational knowledge to explore cutting-edge technologies, sustainable practices, and complex environmental challenges. It is designed for students with a strong background in environmental science or engineering.

chapters.description: Exploration of advanced oxidation processes (AOPs), membrane bioreactors (MBRs), and other emerging technologies for water purification.
Principles and application of mathematical models for simulating and predicting water quality in rivers, lakes, and groundwater systems.
Study of atmospheric processes influencing air pollutant dispersion, including atmospheric stability, wind patterns, and mixing heights.
In-depth analysis of control technologies for particulate matter, NOx, SOx, and VOCs, including scrubbers, filters, and catalytic converters.
Methods for identifying, classifying, and quantifying hazardous wastes based on their physical, chemical, and toxicological properties.
Detailed review of in-situ and ex-situ remediation techniques for contaminated soil and groundwater, including bioremediation, chemical oxidation, and soil vapor extraction.
Principles and methodologies for conducting LCA to evaluate the environmental impacts of products and processes throughout their life cycle.
Application of sustainable design principles to minimize environmental impacts in engineering projects, including resource efficiency, waste reduction, and pollution prevention.
Comprehensive overview of the EIA process, including scoping, impact prediction, mitigation measures, and public participation.
Analysis of environmental regulations and policies at the local, national, and international levels, including environmental permitting and compliance.
Exploration of strategies for reducing greenhouse gas emissions, including renewable energy, carbon capture and storage, and energy efficiency.
Assessment of the impacts of climate change on environmental systems and infrastructure, and development of adaptation strategies to enhance resilience.
